data.title: Protected Disclosures (Whistleblowing): List of prescribed persons
data.text:
The Minister for Public Expenditure, NDP Delivery and Reform signed the Protected Disclosures Act 2014 (Disclosure to Prescribed Persons) (Amendment) Order 2023 in October 2023. Each person listed is prescribed to be the recipient of disclosures of relevant wrongdoings falling within the description of matters specified in column (3) of the Schedule in relation to the person.

If you decide to report to a prescribed person rather than your employer you must make sure that you choose the right person or body for your issue. For example, if you are reporting a breach of data protection law, you should contact the Data Protection Commission.

Below is a list of prescribed persons you can make a protected disclosure to and a description of the matters you can report to them.

Persons who wish to report wrongdoing can also contact the Speak Up Helpline operated by Transparency International Ireland for advice on making a Protected Disclosure.

• All matters relating to the licensing by Coimisiún na Meán of the broadcasting sector and the 3 monitoring by Coimisiún na Meán of all licensed services to ensure that licence holders comply with their statutory obligations and the terms of their licences issued under the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009).

• All matters relating to the development by Coimisiún na Meán of media service codes and media service rules made under Part 3B of the Broadcasting Act 4 2009 (No. 18 of 2009).

• All matters relating to the development by Coimisiún na Meán of online safety codes made under Part 8A of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009).

• All matters falling within the remit of Coimisiún na Meán under Part 8B of the Broadcasting Act 2009 (No. 18 of 2009).”

Contact an appropriate person (the bank, an officer or employee of the Bank or an authorised officer)(within the meaning of section 37(1) of the Central Bank (Supervision and Enforcement) Act 2013 (No. 26 of 2013))

a. the registration, and the enforcement of filing obligations, of companies under the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014), and

(a) the Patents Act 1992 (No. 1 of 1992), the Trade Marks Act 1996 (No. 6 of 1996), the Industrial Designs Act 2001 (No. 39 of 2001), the Copyright and Related Rights Act 2000 (No. 28 of 2000), the Knowledge Development Box (Certification of Inventions) Act 2017 (No. 6 of 2017), the Copyright and other Intellectual Property Law Provisions Act 2019 (No. 19 of 2019),

(c) acts adopted by an institution of the European Union or regulations made under the European Communities Act 1972 (No.27 of 1972).

Contact the Commissioner for Data Protection in the Data Protection Commission or, where there is more than one such Commissioner, the chairperson of the Commission

vi. the disclosure of donations to political parties, members of the Oireachtas, members of the European Parliament, and candidates at elections to Dáil Éireann, Seanad Éireann and the European Parliament,

• All matters within the remit of the Commission for 6 Railway Regulation relating to the regulation of the transportation of dangerous goods by rail.

Contact the chief executive officer of the National Roads Authority (described for operational purposes as Transport Infrastructure Ireland in accordance with the Roads Act (Operational Name of National Roads Authority) Order 2015 (No. 297 of 2015))

A protected disclosure may also be made in person to an authorised person during a monitoring event or investigation or to an inspector of social services in the course of an inspection.

The Chief Executive of each of the following local authorities is the prescribed person for receiving protected disclosures.

Email: disclosures@gsoc.ie (this mailbox is only accessible by the GSOC Commissioners)

Tel: (01) 871 6727 (during office hours and ask to speak to one of the Commissioners about a confidential matter)

xi. the disclosure of donations to political parties, members of the Oireachtas, members of the European Parliament, and candidates at elections to Dáil Éireann, Seanad Éireann and the European Parliament,

xiv. the monitoring of limitations on expenditure by election candidates and political parties, and

Head of the Secretariat to the Standards in Public Office Commission

Contact an appropriate person (the bank, an officer or employee of the Bank or an authorised officer)(within the meaning of section 37(1) of the Central Bank (Supervision and Enforcement) Act 2013 (No. 26 of 2013))

(a) the registration, regulation and classification of tourist accommodation, and

(b) appeals regarding refusal or cancellation of registration of tourist accommodation.

• All matters relating to the market surveillance for cableway subsystems and components.

• All matters within the remit of the Commission for 6 Railway Regulation relating to the regulation of the transportation of dangerous goods by rail.

Contact the chief executive officer of the National Roads Authority (described for operational purposes as Transport Infrastructure Ireland in accordance with the Roads Act (Operational Name of National Roads Authority) Order 2015 (No. 297 of 2015))

[external-link https://www.tii.ie/about/about-tii/Protected Disclosures/TII-Protected-Disclosures-Policy-and-Procedures-non-staff-Appendix-E(ii).pdf | About us ]

Contact a member of the Commission for Regulation of Utilities, or where there is more than one such member, the chairperson of the Commission
